intro: Anastraphia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved anastraphia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, small leaves that are typically arranged in a dense rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited geographic range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
